citations.narrative:
The records for the hedgehogs and sugar gliders were not up to date. The records that were not current included the
record of the animals on hand, records of acquisition (including records of acquisition for the offspring born), and records
of disposition.
Per this Section, dealers shall make and maintain complete records regarding the details of the acquisition and disposition
of animals in their possession to account for the sources of the animals and any animal transfers. The records shall also
include any offspring born of any animals while in his or her control.
The records shall include: the name and address of the person from whom the animals were purchased or otherwise
acquired; the USDA license or registration number of the person if he or she is licensed or registered under the Act, or the
vehicle license number and State, and the driver’s license number and State of the person if he or she is not licensed or
registered under the Act; the name and address of the person to whom an animal was sold or given; the date of purchase,
acquisition, sale, or disposal of the animal(s); the species and number of the animal(s) in the shipment. The Licensee
needs to prepare a record of the animals on hand, records of acquisition for offspring born on the premises and for any
other animals acquired, records of disposition for animals that were sold, and ensure that the animal records are kept
current/up to date for all future animal acquisitions and dispositions. Correct by 9/12/25.
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with facility representatives.
*END OF REPORT*
